docs.snippet: On television Tuesday morning, political pundits were acting like dogs on leashes, chomping at the bit to assess the winners and losers of the presidential election but being reined in by anchors (and John McCain's advisors) who didn't want to get...
docs.lead_paragraph: On television Tuesday morning, political pundits were acting like dogs on leashes, chomping at the bit to assess the winners and losers of the presidential election but being reined in by anchors (and John McCain's advisers) who didn't want to get ahead of the actual results.
docs.abstract: On television Tuesday morning, political pundits were acting like dogs on leashes, chomping at the bit to assess the winners and losers of the presidential election but being reined in by anchors (and John McCain's advisors) who didn't want to get ahead of the actual results.

headline.main: Election: On TV, Nothing to Do but Talk

docs.snippet: Conservatives are already lambasting the Republican candidate....
docs.lead_paragraph: Let the recriminations begin! Republicans usually venerate their defeated presidential candidates, while Democrats usually feast on the bones of their failed nominees. It remains to be seen how conservatives treat John McCain after this election (should he lose, as he appears to be doing). The American Spectator's Quin Hillyer has already published a blog post titled, "McCain Was Terrible."
docs.abstract: Conservatives are already lambasting the Republican candidate.

docs.snippet: On Staten Island, Councilman Michael E. McMahon and former Assemblyman Robert A. Straniere are vying to fill the House seat being vacated by Representative Vito J. Fossella....
docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, 12:40 a.m., Nov. 5 | With bagpipes playing "God Bless America," City Councilman Michael E. McMahon entered the ballroom of a Staten Island catering hall on Tuesday evening, addressing a crown of about 400 people as the winner of the most competitive congressional race in New York City this year. He will succeed Representative Vito J. Fossella, who is leaving Congress.
docs.abstract: On Staten Island, Councilman Michael E. McMahon and former Assemblyman Robert A. Straniere are vying to fill the House seat being vacated by Representative Vito J. Fossella.

headline.main: Democrat Prevails in Staten Island House Race
